ygData.subject: Scottish References (humorous) - was RE: [eqbards] Battle Bards
ygData.msgSnippet: BAGPIPES! YES! (oh, I, ahem, learning to play the bagpipes in RL) How about: Bagpipes, Wind Instrument, - Used with one of the AOE songs to cause some massive
ygData.messageBody:
BAGPIPES! YES!
(oh, I, ahem, learning to play the bagpipes in RL)

How about: Bagpipes, Wind Instrument, - Used with one of the AOE
songs to cause some massive damage to creatures, while giving
some sort of combat bonus?

Hmm...Haggis, Food, - Set up with a skill level, like alcohol.
higher skill level in Haggis eating gives you combat bonuses.
lower skill level eating haggis will make you ill, and
decrease combat abilities.

How about a Barbarian Bard, using bagpipes for wind, bodhran for percussion,
ram's horn for brass, etc., wearing a kilt, and carrying a claymore?

Heh, I would love to play this race/class combo. One big Scottish bard,
running around in a kilt, giving some sort of berserker bonuses to other
barbarians by virtue of playing the bagpipes.

Oh, well...just dreaming

Macgrough
13th on Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tim and Mary Steed [mailto:timandmary@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 3:08 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject:
>
>
> From: "Tim and Mary Steed" <timandmary@...>
>
>
>
> >From: "Elijah Meeker" <elijah@...>
> >
> >Has anyone ever heard a war chant sung by people who are
> actually about to
> go into battle, actually
> >about to kill and be killed? I am not talking roleplaying combat, I mean
> like, say Zulu war chants.
> >I have (albeit in recording not EVEN in person) and they reach
> down to the
> base of your skull and
> >fire up your adrenal system like smelting furnace fed with pure oxygen.
> ====================
>
> I understand and agree!
> I particularly enjoy the bagpipes played by Scots during the
> Napoleonic War.
> For some reason, for me anyway, several pipers playing their music gets me
> blood boilin', lad!
>
> I know, not "EQ related" entirely, but I couldnt pass it up (smile)
>
> Tim
> Tallonn Stringfellow - Bertox
>
